title: code block
rendered:
let data = {|
{
  "some": "json", // with a comment!
  "more": [1,3,],
  "this": {
    "object": {
      "is": {
        "really": "nested"
      }
    }
  },
  "nested": [{
    "and": [1,2,{"stuff": 5}]
  }], // trailing commas!
}
|};
let json = Json.parse(data);
let simple = Json.get("some", json); /* == Some(String("json")) */

/** Yay get us a bind of optionals */
let (|>>) = Json.bind;

let stuff = json
  |> Json.get("nested")
  |>> Json.nth(0)
  |>> Json.get("and")
  |>> Json.nth(2)
  |>> Json.get("stuff")
  |>> Json.number; /* == Some(5.) */

/** Using a json path for nested objects */
let nestedObj = json |> Json.getPath("this.object.is.really"); /* Some(String("nested")) */

let str = Json.stringify(json); /* back to a string */

title: Home
contents: Add rex-json to your package.json and your bsconfig.json.

title: code block
rendered:
open Json.Infix;
let inc = x => x + 1;
let x: int = fold(Some(4), 10, inc);
let y: int = fold(None, 2, inc);
Js.log2(x, y);

title: Infix.fold
contents: It's called fold because that's what people call it :?. It's the same as "transform contents to new value" + "unwrap with default".
rendered: It's called fold because that's what people call it :?. It's the same as "transform contents to new value" + "unwrap with default".

title: Infix.fold
contents: "handle the value if present, otherwise here's the default"
rendered: "handle the value if present, otherwise here's the default"

title: code block
rendered:
open Json.Infix;
let inc = x => x + 1;
let x: option(int) = Some(7) |?>> inc;
let y: option(int) = None |?>> inc;
Js.log2(x, y);

title: Infix.|?>>
contents: The "transform contents into new value & then re-wrap" operator
rendered: The "transform contents into new value & then re-wrap" operator

title: code block
rendered:
open Json.Infix;
let maybeInc = x => x > 5 ? Some(x + 1) : None;
let x: option(int) = Some(14) |?> maybeInc;
let y: option(int) = None |?> maybeInc;

title: Infix.|?>
contents: The "transform contents into new optional" operator
rendered: The "transform contents into new optional" operator

title: code block
rendered:
open Json.Infix;
let x: int = Some(10) |? 4;
let y: int = None |? 5;
Js.log2(x, y);

title: Infix.|!
contents: But you gotta be sure, otherwise it will throw.
rendered: But you gotta be sure, otherwise it will throw.

title: code block

open Json.Infix;
let x: int = Some(10) |! "Expected this to be present";
Js.log(x);

title: Infix.|!
contents: If you're sure there's a value, you can force it.
rendered: If you're sure there's a value, you can force it.

title: t
contents: t string float list t list string t
rendered: type t = | String(string) | Number(float) | Array(list(t)) | Object(list((string, t))) | True | False | Null

title: obj
contents: obj t option list string t

title: code block
rendered:
open Json.Infix;
let json = Json.parse({|{"a": {"b": {"c": 2}}}|});
let num = Json.getPath("a.b.c", json) |?> Json.number;
assert(num == Some(2.))

title: getPath
contents: Get a deeply nested value from an object t.
rendered: Get a deeply nested value from an object t.

title: nth
contents: If t is an array, get the value associated with the given index
rendered: If t is an array, get the value associated with the given index

title: get
contents: If t is an object, get the value associated with the given string key
rendered: If t is an object, get the value associated with the given string key

title: code block
rendered:
let text = {|{"hello": "folks", "aa": [2, 3, "four"]}|};
let result = Json.stringify(Json.parse(text));
Js.log(result);
assert(text == result);

title: parse
contents: Turns some text into a json object. throws on failure
rendered: Turns some text into a json object. throws on failure

title: code block
rendered:
open Json.Infix; /* for the nice infix operators */
let raw = {|{"hello": "folks"}|};
let who = Json.parse(raw) |> Json.get("hello") |?> Json.string;
Js.log(who);
